title: Strange 'Copy Package' Behavior
description: When using 'Copy Package' in org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui within jdt.ui 3.1, selecting 'xxx' as the destination, a package named 'ui' is created within 'xx'.
OB: After performing the 'Copy Package' operation with 'xxx' as the destination, a new package named 'ui' is unexpectedly created within the 'xx' package.
EB: The expected behavior is that the 'Copy Package' operation should create a copy of the selected package without creating any additional packages within it. In this case, selecting 'xxx' as the destination should result in a copied package without any additional 'ui' package within it.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Open org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui in jdt.ui 3.1.
2. Perform the 'Copy Package' operation.
3. Select 'xxx' as the destination when prompted.
